definition: SAP S/4HANA represents the most significant architectural shift in the company's history, moving from a traditional disk-based ERP to a modern digital core built entirely on the in-memory SAP HANA database. This transformation is not merely a technical upgrade but a fundamental re-architecture of business processes, data models, and user experience, designed for the demands of a digital economy.

SAP Fiori is a modern user experience (UX) design framework for SAP applications. It provides a role-based, tile-based, and responsive interface to simplify and unify the user experience across devices.

ABAP (Advanced Business Application Programming) is a high-level, 4th-generation programming language created by SAP. It is the primary language used to develop the vast majority of SAP's applications and provides the framework for customers to create their own custom reports, interfaces, conversions, enhancements, forms, and workflows (RICEFW).

SAP NetWeaver is SAP’s integrated technology platform (middleware). It provides the runtime environment, development tools, and integration capabilities (both ABAP and Java) needed to run SAP applications and integrate SAP with non-SAP systems.

YFB60 is a custom SAP transaction code for bulk-uploading multiple vendor or employee liability invoices (often from Excel) into the FI (Financial Accounting) module. It automates mass invoice entry through a park-and-post (maker-checker) process.
FB60 is a standard SAP FI transaction code used to enter a vendor (supplier) invoice when no purchase order reference is required. It posts a non-PO related invoice into Accounts Payable.

Oriented towards external reporting requirements, providing the data necessary for statutory and legal reporting, such as balance sheets and profit and loss statements. Its key components include the General Ledger (G/L), Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), and Asset Accounting (AA).

Focused on internal management reporting and decision-making. Its purpose is to provide management with the information needed to plan, monitor, and optimize business processes. Key components include Cost Center Accounting (CCA) and Profit Center Accounting (PCA).

The Materials Management (MM) module governs the entire procurement and inventory management lifecycle, often referred to as the 'Procure-to-Pay' process. It is the foundational component for all supply chain activities.

The Sales and Distribution (SD) module manages all processes within the 'Order-to-Cash' cycle. It is the primary interface with the customer, handling everything from initial inquiries and sales orders to the shipment of goods and final invoicing.

SAP PP (Production Planning) is used for manufacturing resource planning and control. It includes material requirements planning (MRP), production orders, capacity planning, bill of materials (BOM) management, and shop floor control.

SAP QM (Quality Management) handles quality inspection and assurance in procurement and production. It supports quality planning, inspection execution, quality certificates, and integration with other modules.

SAP PM (Plant Maintenance) covers maintenance planning and execution for equipment and facilities. It manages preventive and corrective maintenance, maintenance orders, work scheduling, and integration with inventory.

SAP PS (Project System) is used for project planning and control. It manages complex projects by defining project structures (WBS elements, networks), scheduling tasks, and tracking costs and budgets.

SAP PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) supports the management of product data and processes throughout the product’s lifecycle, including engineering change management, document management, and compliance tracking.

In SAP logistics, a Plant is an organizational unit representing a location for production, inventory storage, or distribution. It is assigned to a company code and is the basis for manufacturing and material movements.
A Storage Location is a subdivision of a Plant where inventory is physically stored. Inventory levels and movements are managed at the storage location level.
A Company Code is the smallest organizational unit for which a complete set of financial accounts can be maintained. It represents a legal entity in SAP for financial statements.
A Controlling Area in SAP CO is an organizational unit that encompasses one or more company codes for cost accounting purposes, allowing for cross-company cost tracking.
In SAP S/4HANA, a Business Partner is the master data record for parties the company does business with (customers, vendors, employees). It centralizes business partner data for consistency.
The Chart of Accounts is a structured list of all general ledger accounts used by one or more company codes, defining the account numbers and categories for financial reporting.
SAP HANA is SAP’s in-memory, column-oriented relational database and platform for high-performance analytics and transaction processing, enabling real-time reporting.

SAP ECC (ERP Central Component) is SAP’s on-premises ERP suite (the predecessor to S/4HANA). It includes the core SAP Business Suite modules (FI, CO, MM, SD, etc.) and runs on traditional databases or HANA.
SAP ERP is SAP’s flagship enterprise resource planning software, referring to both SAP ECC and S/4HANA products. It integrates key business functions into a unified system.
SAP BW is a data warehousing solution on SAP NetWeaver that consolidates, transforms, and stores data from SAP and external sources to provide reporting, analytics, and planning.
SAP BW/4HANA is the next-generation data warehousing solution optimized for SAP HANA, simplifying and accelerating data modeling, transformation, and reporting.
SAP BusinessObjects is a suite of business intelligence tools for reporting, analysis, and data visualization, including components like Web Intelligence, Crystal Reports, and Dashboard Designer.
SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a cloud-based analytics platform combining business intelligence, planning, and predictive analytics with interactive dashboards and data exploration features.
SAP IBP is a cloud-based supply chain planning suite for demand planning, inventory optimization, supply planning, and sales & operations planning (S&OP).

SAP EWM is an advanced warehouse management system for managing complex, high-volume distribution centers. It can be deployed decentralized or embedded in S/4HANA and offers advanced features like Slotting, Labor Management, and Task Interleaving.
SAP Transportation Management (SAP TM) is the strategic logistics application designed to manage the entire transportation lifecycle, including freight order management, planning, and settlement.
SAP Ariba is a cloud-based procurement and supply chain platform connecting buyers and suppliers globally to automate sourcing, procurement, invoicing, and supply chain collaboration.
SAP SuccessFactors is a cloud-based Human Capital Management (HCM) suite covering talent management, core HR, payroll, and workforce analytics.
SAP Fieldglass is a cloud-based Vendor Management System (VMS) for managing external workforce and service procurement, including contingent labor and services.
SAP Concur is a cloud-based travel, expense, and invoice management solution that automates travel booking, expense reporting, and invoice processing.
SAP GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) is a suite of solutions for managing enterprise risk and regulatory compliance, including access control and process control.
SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) is SAP’s integrated platform-as-a-service, combining database, analytics, application development, and integration on one unified cloud platform.
SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration) is an integration Platform-as-a-Service that provides tools to integrate SAP and third-party applications across cloud and on-premises.
An IDoc (Intermediate Document) is a standardized SAP data structure for exchanging information between SAP systems or between SAP and non-SAP systems for EDI and ALE.
SAP ALE (Application Link Enabling) is the SAP technology for distributing data (via IDocs) between SAP systems, enabling asynchronous, automated data exchange.
SAP RFC (Remote Function Call) is a protocol and API for calling functions in remote SAP or external systems, enabling synchronous communication.
A BAPI (Business Application Programming Interface) is an SAP-defined, remote-enabled function module that provides standard programming interfaces to SAP business objects.
SAP Gateway is a technology that enables the exposure of SAP business data and processes as OData services, allowing communication with external web and mobile applications.
SAP CDS (Core Data Services) is a data modeling infrastructure within ABAP that allows developers to define semantic data models directly on the SAP HANA database.
SAPUI5 is SAP’s HTML5/Javascript UI framework for building responsive web applications and is the underlying technology for SAP Fiori apps.
SAP Enterprise Portal is a web-based portal that provides a single access point to SAP and non-SAP applications, reports, and collaboration tools.
SAP Solution Manager (SolMan) is an application lifecycle management tool that supports SAP implementations and operations with project management and system monitoring tools.
SAP LSMW (Legacy System Migration Workbench) is a tool for data migration and conversion, enabling the loading of data from legacy systems into SAP.
SAP BAdI (Business Add-In) is an enhancement technique that allows developers to add custom ABAP code to standard SAP programs without modification by implementing predefined hooks.
A Chart of Depreciation in SAP defines the rules and parameters for fixed asset depreciation, such as periods, accounting principles, and depreciation methods.
SAP AA (Asset Accounting) is a sub-module of FI that manages fixed assets, handling acquisitions, capitalization, depreciation, and retirement.
Profit Center Accounting is a sub-component of CO that analyzes financial performance by profit centers, which represent units for internal reporting and profitability analysis.
SAP TR (Treasury) is a financial module that supports cash and liquidity management, treasury accounting, and risk management to help organizations manage financial assets and liabilities.
SAP FM (Funds Management) is used primarily in public sector and nonprofits to manage budgets and appropriations, ensuring spending does not exceed allocated resources.
SAP CS (Customer Service) is part of SAP’s Service Management, handling after-sales service processes including service orders, contracts, warranties, and repairs.

SAP EHS (Environment, Health & Safety) is a solution suite for managing product safety, regulatory compliance, and occupational health, including tools for handling hazardous substances and incident management.

SAP Central Finance is a deployment approach in S/4HANA that creates a centralized finance instance by replicating financial postings from multiple SAP and non-SAP systems into a central S/4HANA system.
SAP C/4HANA (now SAP Customer Experience) is SAP’s suite of customer relationship management and commerce solutions, including Commerce Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Service Cloud.
SAP RE (Real Estate Management) manages a company’s real estate portfolio, handling leasing, rental contracts, space management, and real estate accounting.

SAP FICO (Financial Accounting and Controlling) refers to the integrated modules for managing financial accounting and managerial accounting processes, providing a unified view of financial performance.

SAP HCM (Human Capital Management) is a suite of modules for human resources management, covering organizational management, personnel administration, recruitment, payroll, and performance management.
SAP Payroll (PY) is a component of SAP HCM that processes employee salaries, calculates wages, taxes, and deductions, and integrates payroll results with financial accounting.

SAP CATS (Cross-Application Time Sheet) is an SAP tool that records employee working times and integrates them into various SAP modules for project tracking, maintenance orders, or HR time evaluation.
SAP CRM was an SAP solution for managing customer relationships. Many of its capabilities are now delivered through SAP C/4HANA cloud solutions.
SAP SRM is a procurement solution for managing buying processes and supplier collaboration. Much of its functionality is now available through SAP Ariba.
SAP GTS manages international trade processes, including customs, compliance, and trade documentation, to streamline global supply chain operations.

SAP APO is a suite of supply chain planning tools (part of SAP SCM) that includes modules like Demand Planning (DP), Supply Network Planning (SNP), and Production Planning/Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS).
SAP PI is a middleware component that enables integration of SAP and external systems, using adapters and mappings to route and transform messages between heterogeneous systems.
SAP PO is an integrated platform combining SAP Process Integration (PI), Business Process Management (BPM), and Business Rules Management (BRM) to orchestrate complex business processes.
SAP MDG is an application for centrally managing and governing master data (such as materials, customers, suppliers) with workflows and validations to ensure data consistency.
SAP MDM is an older SAP solution (pre-dating MDG) for consolidating and distributing master data across multiple systems.
SAP FSCM is a suite for optimizing accounts receivable and credit management, including Credit Management, Collections Management, and Dispute Management.
SAP ILM is used for data retention, archiving, and compliance management, allowing organizations to define retention rules for business data according to legal requirements.
SAP Fiori Launchpad is the web-based, tile-based entry point for SAP Fiori apps and transactions, offering a personalized and role-based access to SAP functionalities.
SAP UI Theme Designer is a web application for customizing the visual theme of SAP Fiori and SAP GUI screens, allowing changes to colors, fonts, and branding.
SAP Data Services (BODS) is an ETL (extract, transform, load) tool for data integration, enabling data extraction, transformation, and loading between SAP and non-SAP sources.
SAP Data Intelligence is a cloud-based solution for data orchestration and management, connecting to multiple data sources and providing tools for data preparation and machine learning.
SAP ABAP Workbench is the integrated development environment (IDE) for ABAP, including tools such as the ABAP Editor, Dictionary, Function Builder, and Debugger.
SAP ArchiveLink is an interface framework for linking documents (such as scanned invoices) to SAP business objects, enabling storage in an external archive while attached to transactions in SAP.

FICO represents the central nervous system of the SAP ERP system. It is the definitive system of record for all financial transactions and is responsible for both external and internal financial reporting.
The General Ledger serves as the complete, centralized record of all financial transactions within the FI module.
Accounts Payable manages all processes related to vendors, from invoice posting to payments within the FI module.
Accounts Receivable handles all customer-related accounting, including invoicing and collections within the FI module.
Cost Center Accounting is used to track costs associated with specific functional areas or departments like HR or IT within the CO module.
Profit Center Accounting evaluates the profitability of independent areas within an enterprise, such as a product line or business unit, within the CO module.
Product Cost Controlling is dedicated to determining the costs associated with manufacturing a product or providing a service within the CO module.
A comprehensive record (T-Code MM01) containing all information about a specific product or service, including purchasing, storage, accounting, and sales data.
Centralizes all relevant information about a supplier (T-Code XK01), including address, payment terms, and accounting details.
Stores specific conditions for purchasing a particular material from a specific vendor (T-Code ME11), such as price, delivery time, and quantity tolerances.
An internal document (T-Code ME51N) that signals a need for a material or service.
A formal, legally binding document (T-Code ME21N) sent to a vendor to procure specified goods or services under agreed-upon terms.
A transaction (T-Code MIGO) that records the physical receipt or issue of goods, which updates inventory levels and can trigger financial postings.
The process (T-Code MIRO) where a vendor's invoice is checked against the purchase order and goods receipt to ensure accuracy before payment is processed.
The central repository (T-Code XD01) for all data related to a customer, including general, company code, and sales area data.
The system's ability (T-Code VK11) to determine prices, discounts, surcharges, and taxes, which are stored in condition records and applied automatically during sales order processing.
The customer's formal request to the company to supply goods or services (T-Code VA01). It triggers background checks for material availability and credit limits.
A document (T-Code VL01N) that initiates all subsequent shipping activities, such as picking, packing, and posting the goods issue.
An invoice (T-Code VF01) sent to the customer, which simultaneously creates a corresponding accounts receivable entry in the FI module.

The classic, integrated ERP module providing foundational capabilities for managing inventory at the storage bin level within a warehouse. Best suited for smaller, less complex warehouse environments.
SAP's advanced, strategic solution to manage complex, high-volume distribution centers. It offers advanced capabilities like Slotting, Labor Management, and Task Interleaving.
A fundamental tool for SAP system administrators (T-Code STMS) to manage and control the movement of development objects and configuration settings (transports) across the SAP system landscape.
The classic user interface technology for applications running in the SAP GUI, consisting of a screen with its layout of UI elements and corresponding flow logic (PBO and PAI).
A framework that provides a standardized, interactive grid display for tabular data with built-in functionalities like sorting, filtering, and exporting.
A graphical design tool used to create and maintain formatted output for printing, such as invoices, purchase orders, or delivery notes.
The successor to classic Dynpro, providing a framework for developing professional, browser-based applications based on the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern.
The current and strategic development model for SAP S/4HANA and cloud environments for efficiently building enterprise-ready, OData-based services and Fiori applications.

The highest-level organizational unit within an SAP system. It allows a single physical SAP installation to be partitioned into multiple logical sub-systems that operate as independent business units.
The set of tools and processes used to record and move customizations and development objects (transports) from one SAP system to another.
The most profound innovation within SAP S/4HANA Finance. It introduces a new, single table (ACDOCA) for all accounting line items, serving as the 'single source of truth' for both FI and CO.

A detailed, release-specific document that describes every functional and technical change between SAP ERP 6.0 and the target SAP S/4HANA version. It is the essential guide for any S/4HANA conversion.
A tool that analyzes a customer's existing SAP ERP system and compares its usage data and custom code against the Simplification Item Catalog to produce a personalized migration report.

The legacy, five-phase framework based on a traditional waterfall model that was the standard for implementing SAP ERP. It includes phases like Project Preparation, Business Blueprint, and Realization.

The modern, flexible, and agile-inspired methodology that is the successor to ASAP. It is built on three pillars: SAP Best Practices, Guided Configuration, and a six-phase project approach (Discover, Prepare, Explore, Realize, Deploy, Run).
A comprehensive, fully integrated industry-specific solution that maps the entire retail value chain, from merchandise planning to point-of-sale (POS) transactions.
A process-oriented sales and information system designed to support the complete business cycle of utility and waste disposal companies, including electricity, gas, and water providers.
A specialized solution that addresses the complex supply chain and financial processes of the oil and gas industry, covering upstream, midstream, and downstream operations.
A T-Code to Enter G/L Account Posting in the FI-GL module.
An 'Enjoy' T-Code to Enter a G/L Account Document in the FI-GL module.
A T-Code to Centrally Create, Change, or Display a G/L Account in the FI-GL module.
A T-Code to display G/L Account Line Items in the FI-GL module.
A T-Code to display G/L Account Balances in the FI-GL module.
A T-Code to Enter a Vendor Invoice in the FI-AP module.
A T-Code to display Vendor Line Items in the FI-AP module.
A T-Code to display Vendor Balances in the FI-AP module.
A T-Code to Post Incoming Payments from customers in the FI-AR module.
A T-Code to display Customer Line Items in the FI-AR module.
A T-Code to display Customer Balances in the FI-AR module.
A T-Code to Create an Asset Master Record in the FI-AA module.
A T-Code to Change an Asset Master Record in the FI-AA module.
A T-Code to Display an Asset Master Record in the FI-AA module.
The 'Asset Explorer' T-Code used to get a comprehensive overview of an asset's values and transactions in the FI-AA module.
A T-Code for Asset Acquisition with a Vendor in the FI-AA module.
A T-Code to display Actual Line Items for Internal Orders in the CO module.
A T-Code to display Actual Line Items for Cost Centers in the CO module.
A T-Code to manage Parameters for the Automatic Payment Program in the FI-AP module.
A T-Code to Reset Cleared Items in the FI module.
A T-Code to Reverse a Document in the FI module.
A T-Code to Maintain Tax Codes in the FI module.
A T-Code used for Automatic Account Assignment configuration between the MM and FI modules.
A T-Code to Create a Material Master record in the MM module.
A T-Code to Change a Material Master record in the MM module.
A T-Code to Display a Material Master record in the MM module.
A T-Code to Centrally Create a Vendor Master record.
A T-Code to Centrally Change a Vendor Master record.
A T-Code to Centrally Display a Vendor Master record.
A T-Code to Create a Purchasing Info Record in the MM module.
A T-Code to Maintain a Source List for materials in the MM module.
A T-Code to Create a Purchase Requisition in the MM module.
A T-Code to Change a Purchase Requisition in the MM module.
A T-Code to Display a Purchase Requisition in the MM module.
A T-Code to Create a Purchase Order in the MM module.
A T-Code to Change a Purchase Order in the MM module.
A T-Code to Display a Purchase Order in the MM module.
A T-Code to Release (Approve) a Purchase Order in the MM module.
A T-Code to Create a purchasing Contract in the MM module.
A T-Code to Create a purchasing Scheduling Agreement in the MM module.
A T-Code to Post a Goods Movement (e.g., goods receipt, goods issue) in Inventory Management.
A T-Code for Goods Withdrawal in Inventory Management.
A T-Code for Transfer Posting of materials in Inventory Management.
A T-Code for Other Goods Receipts in Inventory Management.
A T-Code to display a list of Material Documents in Inventory Management.
A T-Code to display a List of Warehouse Stocks on Hand in Inventory Management.
A T-Code to get a Stock Overview for a material in Inventory Management.
A T-Code to Create a Physical Inventory Document in Inventory Management.
A T-Code to Enter an Incoming Invoice for a purchase order in Invoice Verification.
A T-Code to Cancel an Invoice Document in Invoice Verification.
A T-Code to Release Blocked Invoices in Invoice Verification.
A T-Code to Centrally Create a Customer Master record in the SD module.
A T-Code to Centrally Change a Customer Master record in the SD module.
A T-Code to Centrally Display a Customer Master record in the SD module.
A T-Code to Block a Customer in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create a Condition Record (for pricing) in the SD module.
A T-Code to Change a Condition Record (for pricing) in the SD module.
A T-Code to Display a Condition Record (for pricing) in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create a sales Inquiry in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create a sales Quotation in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create a Sales Order in the SD module.
A T-Code to Change a Sales Order in the SD module.
A T-Code to Display a Sales Order in the SD module.
A T-Code to get a List of Sales Orders in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create a sales Contract in the SD module.
A T-Code to Create an Outbound Delivery with an Order Reference in Shipping.
A T-Code to Change an Outbound Delivery in Shipping.
A T-Code to Display an Outbound Delivery in Shipping.
A T-Code to Process a Delivery Due List in Shipping.
A T-Code to Cancel a Goods Issue for a Delivery Note in Shipping.
A T-Code to Create a Shipment in Shipping.
A T-Code to Create a Billing Document (Invoice) in Billing.
A T-Code to Change a Billing Document in Billing.
A T-Code to Display a Billing Document in Billing.
A T-Code to Cancel a Billing Document in Billing.
A T-Code to Process a Billing Due List in Billing.
